p: Finally, Iso e is exponentially linked to temperature, thus global warming is expected to increase the load of volatile compounds ( Fares et al., 2011; Lahr et al., 2015). Nonetheless, a conclusive picture of the effect of climate change on Iso e and hence on the chemistry of the atmosphere is far from being drawn, as the wide range of co-occurring environmental factors (e.g., rising CO 2) may have synergic or antagonistic effects on isoprene biosynthesis ( Dieleman et al., 2012).
